title: QuickBooks is source of truth for payment status - Odoo bills not_paid
description: 99.8% of Odoo bills show 'not_paid' status even though paid. QB is source of truth for payment status. No automated QB integration fields in Odoo. Current billing workflow: Ops creates draft bill → Accounting compares to vendor invoice → If match, finalize in SQL and QB. QB is not synced with Odoo.

title: Multi-PO billing is extremely rare (0.06% of bills)
description: Only 1 bill out of 1,570 bills links to multiple POs. Normal pattern is one PO → multiple bills (partial shipments). 122 POs have 2-7 bills each. This simplifies migration logic as multi-PO consolidation is edge case.

title: Laravel already has purchase order and billing schema
description: Laravel SERP has purchase_orders, purchase_items, and bills tables. purchase_items.bill_id links items to bills. Schema exists but needs odoo_id columns added for dual-source tracking. 4 PO types: inventoried, service, blanket, distribution.

title: SERP Odoo integration is read-only with no write-back sync
description: OdooInventoryService exists but minimal functionality. No write-back sync implemented for PO creation, receiving, or bill reconciliation to Odoo. Currently only reads from Odoo, does not update Odoo state.

title: Finance requires 4 monthly reports for Odoo migration
description: Per Ric: (1) Manufacturing Report, (2) Purchase Order Report, (3) Roll Forward Report (COGS-dependent, most complex), (4) Cash flow visibility for supplier payments. These are dependencies for post-migration success.

title: Data quality issues blocking Odoo migration
description: 355 draft bills stuck worth $3.6M, 48,909 stuck stock moves, 20 PO lines with over-receipts, 482 negative inventory records. These must be resolved before migration to prevent legacy issues.
